p: The age at onset is the most frequently investigated and well established aspect of disease history. Polymorphisms located in the promoter (REP1), introns (rs2736990, rs894278), and 3â€² region (rs356219 and rs356165) are suggested to be predictors of earlier PD onset in Australian and Chinese [ 35], Spanish [ 54], German [ 46], and UK [ 61] samples. The identification of genetic features associated with the onset of PD has a relevant potential for therapeutic targeting. In view of the fact that neurodegeneration precedes the appearance of motor symptoms [ 102], it is critical to predict the risk of developing PD prior to clinical manifestations.
